unit.utterance: [The male Arta speaker's wife is trying to narrate what they experienced in old days, but the male speaker begins to speak in the following discourse.]
unit.utterance_translation: [The male Arta speaker's wife is trying to narrate what they experienced in old days, but the male speaker begins to speak in the following discourse.]

unit.utterance: Awanu ibud a aytidi kakka:nakmi. ta:me:ta i minamaka:mandid.
unit.utterance_translation: I will not say (to my children) that as for my children, other people brought them up (instead of us).

unit.utterance: Konta tamite a passa:sawa, tamite minamaka:mandid ta sakripi:syomi
unit.utterance_translation: Instead, only the two of us, we raised our children through our sacrifice.

unit.utterance: Saya i ginimitmi, ginimitmi a sakripisu
unit.utterance_translation: That we did. We made a sacrifice.

unit.utterance: take:ta mato:lay tidi kakka:nakmi a ta'lo
unit.utterance_translation: so that the three children will live,

unit.utterance: si:pang a gilangan, tallip a bukka:gan.
unit.utterance_translation: one boy and two girls.

unit.utterance: Tidi talloy a, aytidi tallipi a buka:gan
unit.utterance_translation: the two girls

unit.utterance: Ay nedutuli, ta'lo ana:na, tallip a buka:gan, si:pang a gilangan
unit.utterance_translation: As for the first one, her children are three: one boy and two girls.

unit.utterance: ay sumarunoti dinumutuliyan na ana:na,
unit.utterance_translation: The second to the eldest, the first child,

unit.utterance: Uppattid, tal'lu a gilangan,
unit.utterance_translation: They are four: three boys,

unit.utterance: tallip a buka:gan.
unit.utterance_translation: and two girls.

unit.utterance: Aytay, satiddya appumitidiya aytiddya a a:na: didi a:na:mi konta ayti gilangani, awantep ta ana:na.
unit.utterance_translation: Now, these were our grandchildren, our children's children. But as for the man, he has no child.

unit.utterance: Amma bu:titantep i asawana aytay a langit, aytay a kwa.
unit.utterance_translation: The wife of Bulleo is pregnant

unit.utterance: bulan.
unit.utterance_translation: this month.

unit.utterance: [INTERVIEWER] ("I haven't heard of how you took care of your children.")
unit.utterance_translation: [INTERVIEWER] I haven't heard of how you took care of your children.

unit.utterance: Nammulamulaami ta pagay.
unit.utterance_translation: We planted rice.

unit.utterance: take:ta amma to:lay tidi kakka:nakmi.
unit.utterance_translation: so that our children will live.

unit.utterance: Amma makamulaya:mi ta pagay, amma mangga:niami,
unit.utterance_translation: If we plant rice, then we harvest (it),

unit.utterance: mamurabmantèn ta laman aydi taluni take:ta atti yakkanmi a laman
unit.utterance_translation: (and) I hunt wild pigs from the forest so that we have food of wild pig

unit.utterance: ki:gad a awan kinuma:man tidi kakka:nakmi a ta'lo.
unit.utterance_translation: until our three children will have grown up.

unit.utterance: munata.
unit.utterance_translation: (our life) was like that.

unit.utterance: [INTERVIEWER] ("When they are sick, what are you doing? Where will you bring them?")
unit.utterance_translation: [INTERVIEWER] When they are sick, what are you doing? Where will you bring them?

unit.utterance: Amma manga:paditéng tidi kakka:nakmi ay tidi, amma tatin i mapaditéng didi kakka:nakmi a ta'lo.
unit.utterance_translation: If the three children are sick, or if someone among our three children gets sick,

unit.utterance: Awan ta pangalapanmi ta kuwartomi da awanman ta kuwartomi, mammurabtén ta laman.
unit.utterance_translation: We have nothing (valuable) to get for (getting) our money because we do not have money, (so) I go hunting for wild pigs.

unit.utterance: ila:kumi ta kuwarto.
unit.utterance_translation: We sell it for (getting) money (for sending his child to the hospital).

unit.utterance: Saya pampadoktormid i kakka:nakmi amma atti manga:paditéng.
unit.utterance_translation: Then we bring our children to the doctor if (one of them) got sick.

unit.utterance: Amma mapi:piyadmandi manga:y-amid ti bunbunmi.
unit.utterance_translation: When she got well, we go back to our home.

unit.utterance: Mantaraba:hoami ta, pammulamulaami ta pagay aydi kamo:ti, aydi galiyang aydi u:bi.
unit.utterance_translation: We work planting rice, sweet potato, galiyang, and ubi.

unit.utterance: Amma awan ta baggatmi, aytidi kamo:ti, galiyang, saya a panga:nénmi a mangiyakkanmi ta laman.
unit.utterance_translation: If we don't have rice, it is sweet potato or galiyang which are food and cook wild pig.

unit.utterance: Munata i bu:haymi aydi:ti ta dutul a langit,
unit.utterance_translation: Our life before was like that

unit.utterance: ta kaki:léktep tidi kakka:nakmi.
unit.utterance_translation: when our children were young.

unit.utterance: [INTERVIEWER] ("What do you feel happy for?")
unit.utterance_translation: [INTERVIEWER] What do you feel happy for?

unit.utterance: Aytidi kakka:nakmi a tal'lo,
unit.utterance_translation: As for our three children,

unit.utterance: awan ta mesessubég did
unit.utterance_translation: no one is impatient with the others.

unit.utterance: me''a:nustid a ta'lo.
unit.utterance_translation: They are kind.

unit.utterance: ki:gad a nangasawatid,
unit.utterance_translation: until they got married.

unit.utterance: Amma isugunu:d-utid a mangaytid mamtaraba:ho madditde:tid.
unit.utterance_translation: If I tell them to go to work (because) they become teenagers,

unit.utterance: mangaytid mantaraba:ho take:ta to:pandiami a passa:sawa a mantaraba:ho ta panga:nénmi da kakka:mandi a tidi a:na:mi.
unit.utterance_translation: They came to work so that they will accompany us to work for our food because our children grew up.

unit.utterance: [INTERVIEWER] ("How did you bring them to the school?")
unit.utterance_translation: [INTERVIEWER] How did you bring them to the school?

unit.utterance: tidi tallipi a buka:gan, awantid nakapanga:dal da
unit.utterance_translation: As for the two female (children), they didn't learn [i.e. receive any schooling], because

unit.utterance: aydi:ti ta dutul, mangantingami ta ay impi:i aydi sinda:lu, numangayami ti bukibukidi. Awan ti nakapangiskuela.
unit.utterance_translation: in those days, we feared NPAs (New People's Army) and Sundalo soldiers, so we went to the forest. So they could not go to school.

unit.utterance: Ay gilangani a ana:mi,
unit.utterance_translation: As for our son,

unit.utterance: Saya i napaiskuelami da numangayamid ti ayti Barangay na Disimungal aydi:ti.
unit.utterance_translation: we were able to send him to school, because we came here to barangay Disimungal at that time.

unit.utterance: Da pinagiskuelami, ayti barangay,
unit.utterance_translation: Because we let him go to school in this Barangay,

unit.utterance: saya nappaeskuela ti ana:mi a gilangan ti Bulleo
unit.utterance_translation: so our son Bulleo went to school.

unit.utterance: Pinaeskelana kigad ta grad 5 i na'abutna.
unit.utterance_translation: He went to school until he reached fifth grade [lit. until the fifth grade was what he reached].

unit.utterance: Awandi nakatu:luy da awanmandi ta kuwartomi. Awande:ta kuwartomi.
unit.utterance_translation: It was impossible to continue because we didn't have money again. We didn't have money any longer.

unit.utterance: Saya ginumi:nekdi nangiskuela, ay ana:mi a gilangan aydi:ti.
unit.utterance_translation: So my son stopped schooling at that time.

unit.utterance: [INTERVIEWER] ("Do you have any funny stories of your children when they were young?")
unit.utterance_translation: [INTERVIEWER] Do you have any funny stories of your children when they were young?

unit.utterance: Ay uli:ti, pakka:rawègdi ay ta dutul a langit. Awantid me:te:tuntu:ru.
unit.utterance_translation: In the past, he was playful. One cannot discipline them.

unit.utterance: Ay tidi kakka:nakmi, amma
unit.utterance_translation: As for our children, if

unit.utterance: pagi:nakènmitid da maski mepeppu:nèdipu:nèdi makakarakarawèg tid ta lattong.
unit.utterance_translation: we stop them because even if it is raining, they tend to play outside.

unit.utterance: Awantid ma:na:nawad a mekekkarawègtid tidi kakka:nakmi.
unit.utterance_translation: They (children) could not be prevented from playing.

unit.utterance: Maski anginmitid pasdèpèn ti bunbunmi,
unit.utterance_translation: Even if we would tell them to go inside our house,

unit.utterance: Mangayte:tid ta lattong a awan ta ba:baruwasidi a pakakkèrèwèg ti diso:no ni
unit.utterance_translation: They would just go outside, with no clothing, play in this (forest).

unit.utterance: Angaytid ti kettalutalu:nani diso:nona masasa:sèdsèdtid ti talunya.
unit.utterance_translation: They went to the forest, into it. They went into the mountains/bush.

unit.utterance: ki:gad a awande:tid madègnin a
unit.utterance_translation: until they felt cold and

unit.utterance: Mangayde:tid maddingding ti du:ti
unit.utterance_translation: they go to heat themselves near the fire.

unit.utterance: Tungpanmi du:ti angayde:tid mandingding.
unit.utterance_translation: We would light fire to bring them to heat themselves.

unit.utterance: Punanna i ni babakati a "sadma:nina pakakèrkèrèwègmu ti taluni mepeppu:nèdi."
unit.utterance_translation: The old woman said, “that is because you keep on playing in the forest even when it rains!”

unit.utterance: Saya.
unit.utterance_translation: That is it.

unit.utterance: Mangaytid ta wagèt, mandi:muy.
unit.utterance_translation: They go to the river, bathing.

unit.utterance: manga:dègninde:tid, satepde: tidi kakka:nak
unit.utterance_translation: These children become cold

unit.utterance: ki:gad amma alas kuwatrod.
unit.utterance_translation: until four o'clock.

unit.utterance: Bahagtiddyay mangay ti bunbunmi, malu:tèpdi.
unit.utterance_translation: In the afternoon, they would come nearer, come (back) to our house.

unit.utterance: Awandid ma'asika:so mamangan da si:pang a obrandi pakadi:di:muy ti wagèti.
unit.utterance_translation: They didn't even take care of eating because their buisness was just bathing (swimming) in the river.

unit.utterance: Tippurpurte. Awan ta ulèsna.
unit.utterance_translation: He was just naked. He did not have clothes on him [i.e. not dressed].

unit.utterance: [AUDIENCE, speaker's wife] ("We did not have clothes.")
unit.utterance_translation: [AUDIENCE, speaker's wife] We did not have clothes.

unit.utterance: Ay pulo:ti.
unit.utterance_translation: As for loinclothes,

unit.utterance: Awan ta pulot ay atti: pulopulot ay way ulit ni ayuy a tinengteng a pappunandi ti way karagatan.
unit.utterance_translation: There was no loincloth, oh there were loincloths (made) of the bark which was hammered like this with a stone.

unit.utterance: Tottokto:kandi.
unit.utterance_translation: They would pound it.

unit.utterance: Awandi ti wagèt ibilagdi. Saya pappulot didi ammamiti ta dutul
unit.utterance_translation: There was no water (becaue) they let it dry. This is the loincloth of our fathers before

unit.utterance: Ayti ulit ni ayuy a agi a attanandi.
unit.utterance_translation: (made) from the bark of the tree or "agi" cloth in their place.

unit.utterance: Saya i gimitèndi a pulot.
unit.utterance_translation: This, what they make, is a loincloth.

unit.utterance: Awan ta agi.
unit.utterance_translation: There were no clothes.

unit.utterance: [AUDIENCE, speaker's wife] (The speaker's wife is telling the Ilokano interviewer about the process of how they make loinclothes in Ilokano.)
unit.utterance_translation: [AUDIENCE, speaker's wife] (The speaker's wife is telling to the Ilokano interviewer about the process of how they make loinclothes in Ilokano.)

unit.utterance: Awan ta barowa:si.
unit.utterance_translation: There were no clothes.

unit.utterance: Amma iwadi ti tabug aydi tèpa a melellunna
unit.utterance_translation: They place it on the soft soil,

unit.utterance: iwadita, amma tallip a langit, midit ti wagèti.
unit.utterance_translation: put it there (under the mud); after two days, they wash it in the water.

unit.utterance: Piliandi tabug ni barowasi.
unit.utterance_translation: They remove the mud from the clothes.

unit.utterance: Saya i ta:pis didi buka:gani.
unit.utterance_translation: That is the clothes of women.

unit.utterance: Siyèy dimanna a:yi:. Munati tiyèdna ayti.
unit.utterance_translation: He walks on here. His legs were like this here.

unit.utterance: Saya iggamanna a:yi: ni kanakannaki.
unit.utterance_translation: This is how he would carry this child

unit.utterance: da awan ta barowa:si a
unit.utterance_translation: because (they) did not have clothes

unit.utterance: pangabbitdi.
unit.utterance_translation: carrying them.

unit.utterance: Munata aydi:ti ta dutul a langit a ammami.
unit.utterance_translation: It was like this before, our parents.

unit.utterance: Saya i traba:hodid a nintami di aydi:ti ta kaki:lèkmi.
unit.utterance_translation: That was their work that we saw when we were young.

unit.utterance: Munata i taraba:ho didi ammami
unit.utterance_translation: The work of our fathers is like that.

unit.utterance: Awandi ti tiyèddi ayti. Iniggamanmi ti ayti.
unit.utterance_translation: Their legs are not here. We carried (them) here.

unit.utterance: Maddimadimatid.
unit.utterance_translation: They move.

unit.utterance: Maski mababa:bagio.
unit.utterance_translation: Even if (there is) a typhoon,

unit.utterance: Amma mabba:gio,
unit.utterance_translation: if (there is) a typhoon,

unit.utterance: Manga:yamid ti wadidi karagatan a melellawa.
unit.utterance_translation: we would go into thingummy [i.e. hole] of the wide rock.

unit.utterance: Saya attananmi
unit.utterance_translation: This would be our place. [i.e. we would stay there]

unit.utterance: mabba:ba:gio.
unit.utterance_translation: (while) (there is) a typhoon.

unit.utterance: Mantungpaamid ta diso:no ni karagatani
unit.utterance_translation: We heat the inside of the rock by making a fire.

unit.utterance: Mantungpaamid. Saya i paddingdinganmi.
unit.utterance_translation: We would heat (it). That is our heating place.

unit.utterance: Masi:gite ba:gio awan magittud
unit.utterance_translation: The typhoon continued, and it couldn't stop

unit.utterance: ki:gad a awan gumi:nak i bagioy.
unit.utterance_translation: until the typhoon stopped.

unit.utterance: Mangayde:tid mamurab da awan ta anènmi a mabaw.
unit.utterance_translation: They would go hunting because we did not have carbohydrate food.

unit.utterance: Mangayde:tid mamurab.
unit.utterance_translation: They would go hunting.

unit.utterance: Maka:laptid ta laman aydi bidut.
unit.utterance_translation: They were able to get wild pigs and deer.

unit.utterance: Mandu:tungde:tid a manwa ta lamani, manda:pakami.
unit.utterance_translation: They singe the wild pigs and roast them.

unit.utterance: Ay biyasi, saya i panguwami ta panguwandi ta naga:gèlgèl a laman,
unit.utterance_translation: As for the bamboo container, we put the sliced wild pig meat (into there).

unit.utterance: Saya pangi:lutuwandi da awan man ta kande:ro aydi:ti.
unit.utterance_translation: That was their cooking (instrument) because they did not have a pot before.

unit.utterance: [INTERVIEWER, in Ilokano] (The Ilokano speaker asks the speaker to talk about his children and their future prospects.)
unit.utterance_translation: [INTERVIEWER, in Ilokano] (The Ilokano speaker asks the speaker to talk about his children and their future prospects.)

unit.utterance: Kabbatmi mina a aydi:ta
unit.utterance_translation: We want to (fragmental)

unit.utterance: Aydi:ti ta dutul a langit a munata i bu:haymi,
unit.utterance_translation: Our life was like that in those days.

unit.utterance: Ayde:tay a nagisukuela tidi a:na:mi, appumi,
unit.utterance_translation: Now that our children and grandchildren go to school.

unit.utterance: Awanmi arigèn i traba:homi aydi:ti ta dutul a langit
unit.utterance_translation: We will never follow the work we did before.

unit.utterance: da nangisukuela tidi kakka:nakmi aytay a dagun
unit.utterance_translation: because our children go to school nowadays

unit.utterance: ki:gad a awan makatorpos tidi kakka:nakmi
unit.utterance_translation: until our children will have graduated

unit.utterance: Talaga me:tamid i ay mepeppiya a attinanmi
unit.utterance_translation: we can surely see a beautiful place for us (to live).

unit.utterance: da naka'a:dalde:tidi kakka:nakmi aytidi appumi,
unit.utterance_translation: because our children and grandchildren will finish schooling.

unit.utterance: Saddya i pangintanmi ta mepeppiyasika i mangisukuela (da)
unit.utterance_translation: this is our future, the beauty of going to school.

unit.utterance: Attanan a mepeppiyadi pangattinanmi a bunbun,
unit.utterance_translation: All the houses that we live in will be beautiful.

unit.utterance: awandi kapare:ho aydi:ti ta dutul a langit a mememmarakèt.
unit.utterance_translation: which are not like before, namely bad (ones).

unit.utterance: Saya i kabba:to a mapasa:makdi ayde:tay a dagun da
unit.utterance_translation: That is what I want to happen these days because

unit.utterance: aytidi appokoy a buka:gan a panga:nay ana:ni Joli,
unit.utterance_translation: Juli's daughter is our eldest grandchildren.

unit.utterance: Ensi:na ki:gad ta grade 5 ayde:tay
unit.utterance_translation: Until grade 5 now.

unit.utterance: pangiskuelana aytay Grade 5di
unit.utterance_translation: now her schooling is now in grade 5

unit.utterance: ki:gad mina ta haisukuli ma:di:san na pangiskuelana, take:ta
unit.utterance_translation: Until she will be in high school, she will receive schooling.

unit.utterance: Me:tana i mepeppiya a attinanmi.
unit.utterance_translation: So she will see that there is a good place for us to live.

unit.utterance: pati tami ha:bang manga:to:layami
unit.utterance_translation: while we are alive.

unit.utterance: Me:tamiminatep a mepeppiyad i bu:haydi aytay a dagun
unit.utterance_translation: We will see that our life will be good again this year.

unit.utterance: Saya i kabbatmi a mapasa:mak ta bu:haymi aytay.
unit.utterance_translation: That is what we want to happen to our life now.

unit.utterance: palakpa:kanu
unit.utterance_translation: NC
